page.title: 06SAWMILL COTTAGE,KIRKCOWAN
page.content: Mr.Ian Marsh makes{huts,stobbs,fences and {garages.}He has no workers just now but he used to employ a worker.Mr Ian Marsh{planted}a wood in{1966}of{ {coniferous}and deciduous trees.The marshes have lived on the poultry farm for 24 years.The land covers 5 acres. Mr Marsh gets his wood from Glentrool{ {Forestry Commission,}but he used to get from Sorbie wood.They pay{Â£690 {for 20tons}of wood.There are also two hen houses Beaken and Mactagger.There used to be an {Incubator house}but it is not in use now.There used to be 12 sheds with 100 hens in each one.At one stage Mr.M.Marsh had{7000 hens}laying. A little track with a tractor took the hens feeding and collected the eggs. The Marsh family own half of the{River {Tarff}and the council own the other half. { }
